item.title:
It's tempting to see @Base's success and to try and copy their strategy (modulo superficial branding)
The builder realizes that they will need to build a unique application to differentiate, and control the full-stack

item.title:
R to @KAndrewHuang: Our goal for Conduit is to reduce TCO by so much that even a free rollup platform would be a worse option.
Here are a few examples of how we do that.
item.dc:creator: @KAndrewHuang
item.description:
Our goal for Conduit is to reduce TCO by so much that even a free rollup platform would be a worse option.

Here are a few examples of how we do that.

item.title:
R to @KAndrewHuang: The best teams don‚Äôt look at rollup costs as a set of vendor line items.
They evaluate each piece of the rollup by its impact on total cost of operations. What do my infra choices cost not just in dollars, but in time, overhead, and opportunity?
item.dc:creator: @KAndrewHuang
item.description:
The best teams don‚Äôt look at rollup costs as a set of vendor line items.

They evaluate each piece of the rollup by its impact on total cost of operations. What do my infra choices cost not just in dollars, but in time, overhead, and opportunity?

item.title:
It doesn‚Äôt cost $10 million to launch a rollup.
But more importantly, you‚Äôre thinking about rollup costs all wrong.
Study Nvidia. Study Jensen Huang.
‚ÄúOur total cost of operations is so good that even when competitors‚Äô chips are free, it‚Äôs not cheap enough.‚Äù

item.title:
RT by @KAndrewHuang: Unichain is live!
L2s should be designed with the needs of applications and users in mind
Uniswap created the @Optimism chain they would most want to build on as a DeFi app
Then made that platform available permissionlessly for any developer

item.title: RT by @KAndrewHuang: Bundling and unbundling
item.dc:creator: @conduitxyz
item.description:
Bundling and unbundling

nitter.freedit.eu/JacobEv3rly/status/1888977696547303801#m

item.title:
RT by @KAndrewHuang: Bundling and unbundling cycles for products happen across all industries.
For the last few years we have seen hyper specialized pieces in the "modular era" in an unbundling phase, however over the next few years will see a bundling phase to offer these pieces together
People will pay the premium to use bundled solutions to lower GTM times, reduce development costs and have a higher quality of service.
The premium people will pay for convenience is often overlook in this space, in favor of idealistic solutions that maximize efficiency.
Study @conduitxyz @boundless_xyz @arbitrum @Optimism @zksync @avax
item.dc:creator: @JacobEv3rly
item.description:
Bundling and unbundling cycles for products happen across all industries.

For the last few years we have seen hyper specialized pieces in the "modular era" in an unbundling phase, however over the next few years will see a bundling phase to offer these pieces together

People will pay the premium to use bundled solutions to lower GTM times, reduce development costs and have a higher quality of service.

The premium people will pay for convenience is often overlook in this space, in favor of idealistic solutions that maximize efficiency.

Study @conduitxyz @boundless_xyz @arbitrum @Optimism @zksync @avax
